Global

Type Definitions

AccessToken

There are two APIs in Chain Core: the client API and the network API. Each API is authenticated using access tokens with HTTP Basic Authentication.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/learn-more/authentication
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String User specified, unique identifier.
token String Only returned in the response from AccessTokensApi~create.
type String Either 'client' or 'network'.
createdAt String Timestamp of token creation, RFC3339 formatted.

Account

An account is an object in Chain Core that tracks ownership of assets on a blockchain by creating and tracking control programs.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/accounts
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String Unique account identifier.
alias String User specified, unique identifier.
keys Array.<Key> The list of keys used to create control programs under the account. Signatures from these keys are required for spending funds held in the account.
quorum Number The number of keys required to sign transactions for the account.
tags Object User-specified tag structure for the account.

Asset

An asset is a type of value that can be issued on a blockchain. All units of a given asset are fungible. Units of an asset can be transacted directly between parties without the involvement of the issuer.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/assets
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String Globally unique identifier of the asset. Asset version 1 specifies the asset id as the hash of: - the asset version - the asset's issuance program - the core's VM version - the hash of the network's initial block
alias String User specified, unique identifier.
issuanceProgram String
keys Array.<Key> The list of keys used to issue units of the asset.
quorum Number The number of signatures required to issue new units of the asset.
defintion Object User-specified, arbitrary/unstructured data visible across blockchain networks. Version 1 assets specify the definition in their issuance programs, rendering the definition immutable.
tags Object User-specified tag structure for the asset.

Balance

Any balance on the blockchain is simply a summation of unspent outputs. Unlike other queries in Chain Core, balance queries do not return Chain Core objects, only simple sums over the amount fields in a specified list of unspent output objects

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/queries
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
amount Number Sum of the unspent outputs.
sumBy Object List of parameters on which to sum unspent outputs.

batchCallback(error, batchResponse)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error error
batchResponse BatchResponse Newly created objects (and errors).

CoreInfo

Basic information about the configuration of Chain Core, as well as any errors encountered when updating the local state of the blockchain

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/get-started/configure
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
snapshot Object
Properties
Name Type Description
attempt Number
height Number
size Number
downloaded Number
inProgress Boolean
isConfigured Boolean Whether the core has been configured.
configuredAt String RFC3339 timestamp reflecting when the core was configured.
isSigner Boolean Whether the core is configured as a block signer.
isGenerator Boolean Whether the core is configured as the blockchain generator.
generatorUrl String URL of the generator.
generatorAccessToken String The access token used to connect to the generator.
blockchainId String Hash of the initial block.
blockHeight Number Height of the blockchain in the local core.
generatorBlockHeight Number Height of the blockchain in the generator
generatorBlockHeightFetchedAt String RFC3339 timestamp reflecting the last time generator_block_height was updated.
isProduction Boolean Whether the core is running in production mode.
networkRpcVersion Number The network version supported by this core.
coreId String A random identifier for the core, generated during configuration.
version String The release version of the cored binary.
buildCommit String Git SHA of build source.
buildDate String Unixtime (as string) of binary build.
health Object Blockchain error information.

FeedProcessor(item, next, done, fail)

Called once for every item received via the transaction feed.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
item Object Item to process.
next function Continue to the next item when it becomes available. Passing true to this callback will update the feed to acknowledge that the current item was consumed.
done function Terminate the processing loop. Passing true to this callback will update the feed to acknowledge that the current item was consumed.
fail function Terminate the processing loop due to an application-level error. This callback accepts an optional error argument. The feed will not be updated, and the current item will not be acknowledged.

Key

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
rootXpub String
accountXpub String
accountDerivationPath Array.<String>

MockHsmKey

Cryptographic private keys are the primary authorization mechanism on a blockchain. For development environments, Chain Core provides a convenient MockHSM.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/keys
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
alias String User specified, unique identifier of the key.
xpub String Hex-encoded string representation of the key.

objectCallback(error, object)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error error
object Object Object response from API.

pageCallback(error, page)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
error error
page Page Requested page of results.

QueryProcessor(item, next, done)

Called once for each item in the result set.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
item Object Item to process.
next function Call to proceed to the next item for processing.
done function Call to terminate iteration through the result set. Accepts an optional error argument which will be passed to the promise rejection or callback depending on async calling style.

Receiver

A receiver is an object that wraps an account control program with additional payment information, such as expiration dates.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/control-programs
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
controlProgram String The underlying control program that will be used in transactions paying to this receiver.
expiresAt String Timestamp indicating when the receiver will cease to be valid, RFC3339 formatted.

Transaction

A blockchain consists of an immutable set of cryptographically linked transactions. Each transaction contains one or more actions.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/transaction-basics
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String Unique transaction identifier.
timestamp String Time of transaction, RFC3339 formatted.
blockId String Unique identifier, or block hash, of the block containing a transaction.
blockHeight Number Height of the block containing a transaction.
position Number Position of a transaction within the block.
referenceData Object User specified, unstructured data embedded within a transaction.
isLocal Boolean A flag indicating one or more inputs or outputs are local.
inputs Array.<TransactionInput> List of specified inputs for a transaction.
outputs Array.<TransactionOutput> List of specified outputs for a transaction.

TransactionInput

Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Argument Description
type String The type of the input. Possible values are "issue", "spend".
assetId String The id of the asset being issued or spent.
assetAlias String The alias of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetDefinition Hash The definition of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetTags Hash The tags of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetIsLocal Boolean A flag indicating whether the asset being issued or spent is local.
amount Integer The number of units of the asset being issued or spent.
spentOutputId String The id of the output consumed by this input. ID is nil if this is an issuance input.
accountId String The id of the account transferring the asset (possibly null if the input is an issuance or an unspent output is specified).
accountAlias String The alias of the account transferring the asset (possibly null if the input is an issuance or an unspent output is specified).
accountTags String The tags associated with the account (possibly null).
issuanceProgram String A program specifying a predicate for issuing an asset (possibly null if input is not an issuance).
referenceData Object User specified, unstructured data embedded within an input (possibly null).
isLocal Boolean A flag indicating if the input is local.
inputWitness String <optional>
 DEPRECATED (as of version 1.1) Do not use this field.
controlProgram String <optional>
 DEPRECATED (as of version 1.1) Do not use this field.

TransactionOutput

Each new transaction in the blockchain consumes some unspent outputs and creates others. An output is considered unspent when it has not yet been used as an input to a new transaction. All asset units on a blockchain exist in the unspent output set.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/unspent-outputs
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String The id of the output.
type String The type of the output. Possible values are "control" and "retire".
purpose String The purpose of the output. Possible values are "receive" and "change".
position Number The output's position in a transaction's list of outputs.
assetId String The id of the asset being issued or spent.
assetAlias String The alias of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetDefinition Hash The definition of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetTags Hash The tags of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetIsLocal Boolean A flag indicating whether the asset being issued or spent is local.
amount Integer The number of units of the asset being issued or spent.
accountId String The id of the account transferring the asset (possibly null).
accountAlias String The alias of the account transferring the asset (possibly null).
accountTags String The tags associated with the account (possibly null).
controlProgram String The control program which must be satisfied to transfer this output.
referenceData Object User specified, unstructured data embedded within an input (possibly null).
isLocal Boolean A flag indicating if the input is local.

UnspentOutput

Each new transaction in the blockchain consumes some unspent outputs and creates others. An output is considered unspent when it has not yet been used as an input to a new transaction. All asset units on a blockchain exist in the unspent output set.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/build-applications/unspent-outputs
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Description
id String Unique transaction identifier.
type String The type of the output. Possible values are "control" and "retire".
purpose String The purpose of the output. Possible values are "receive" and "change".
transactionId String The transaction containing the output.
position Number The output's position in a transaction's list of outputs.
assetId String The id of the asset being issued or spent.
assetAlias String The alias of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetDefinition Object The definition of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetTags Object The tags of the asset being issued or spent (possibly null).
assetIsLocal Boolean A flag indicating whether the asset being issued or spent is local.
amount Number The number of units of the asset being issued or spent.
accountId String The id of the account transferring the asset (possibly null).
accountAlias String The alias of the account transferring the asset (possibly null).
accountTags Object The tags associated with the account (possibly null).
controlProgram String The control program which must be satisfied to transfer this output.
referenceData Object User specified, unstructured data embedded within an input (possibly null).
isLocal Boolean A flag indicating if the input is local.
